snippet: Brazil’s foreign minister dismissed Secretary of State John Kerry’s explanation of the data collection by the National Security Agency and said it “cast a shadow of distrust” over bilateral relations.
abstract: Brazilian Foreign Min Antonio Patriota excoriates surveillance practices of United States, dismissing as unsatisfactory Sec of State John Kerry’s explanation of wide-ranging collection of data on telephone and electronic communications and describing spying as 'new type of challenge' in Brazil’s relationship with United States.
lead_paragraph: Brazil’s foreign minister dismissed Secretary of State John Kerry’s explanation of the data collection by the National Security Agency and said it “cast a shadow of distrust” over bilateral relations.

headline.main: In Brazil, Kerry Is Told Spying Sows ‘Distrust’
headline.print_headline: In Brazil, Kerry Is Told Spying Sows ‘Distrust’
